item.title: Almost added vote4cash! HELP
item.dc:creator: @David321 David321
item.description:
@David321 wrote:

i putted inside this

public boolean checkVotes(String playerName) { try { String urlString = "http://banditpkz.com/vote.php?type=checkvote&username="+playerName; urlString = urlString.replaceAll(" ", "%20"); URL url = new URL(urlString); BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(url.openStream())); String results = reader.readLine(); if(results.length() > 0) { if(results.equals("user needs reward...")) return true; else return false; } } catch (MalformedURLException e) { System.out.println("Malformed URL Exception in checkVotes(String playerName)"); } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("IO Exception in checkVotes(String playerName)"); } return false; }

item.title: Almost added vote4cash! HELP
item.dc:creator: @David321 David321
item.description:
@David321 wrote:

[quote=“Native^, post:2, topic:433661”]The

import server.util;

Does not make sense because you have to import a class, or a whole package. You can do this by doing this.

import server.util.*;

^ This will import the whole package with all the containing classes.
Or

import server.util.Class;

If you only want to import one class.

The other error means there is no method called “checkVotes” in the Client class.[/quote]

ok but i am having error again

Read full topic

item.title: Almost added vote4cash! HELP
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

The

import server.util;

Does not make sense because you have to import a class, or a whole package. You can do this by doing this.

import server.util.*;

^ This will import the whole package with all the containing classes.
Or

import server.util.Class;

If you only want to import one class.

The other error means there is no method called “checkVotes” in the Client class.

Read full topic
